Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
Uranus
Hideyuki Nakashima <nakashim@el.go.jp>, 1993. A logic-based knowledge representation language. An extension of Prolog written in Common Lisp, with Lisp-like syntax. Extends Prolog with a multiple world mechanism, plus term descriptions to provide functional programming.
{(ftp://etlport.etl.go.jp/pub/uranus/ftp)}.

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Uranus \U"ra*nus\ (-n[u^]s), n. [L. Uranus, Gr. O'yrano`s Uranus, o'yrano`s heaven, sky. Cf. {Uranium}.] [1913 Webster] 1. (Gr. Myth.) The son or husband of Gaia (Earth), and father of Chronos (Time) and the Titans. [1913 Webster]
2. (Astron.) One of the primary planets. It is about 1,800,000,000 miles from the sun, about 36,000 miles in diameter, and its period of revolution round the sun is nearly 84 of our years. [1913 Webster]
Note: This planet has also been called {Herschel}, from Sir William Herschel, who discovered it in 1781, and who named it {Georgium Sidus}, in honor of George III., then King of England. [1913 Webster]

Uranus n 1: (Greek mythology) god of the heavens; son and husband of Gaea and father of the Titans in ancient mythology [syn: {Ouranos}] 2: a giant planet with a ring of ice particles; 7th from the sun
